Title: A Tale of Two Detectives Ep.2
SubTitle: No Translation

Text:
After school, once the other students leave the
classroom, it is finally time for the two of them
to start their investigation and find the sender
of the threatening letter.
Cid! Can we jump right into it?

I didn't return to the lab today, so I had extra time
to think about the culprit.
Do you have any leads?
I do... My mind did arrive at one person.
Ohh? Who is it?
The shock might kill you, Cid...
Oh, really? Who is it?
It was...Alexia!
Alexia?
Yes! I think Alexia is very suspicious!
You might wanna say that a little quieter.
Ack! Oh-whoa, yes, you're right!

Sherry reflexively looks around...then she sighs in
relief when she sees that the classroom is empty.
I almost committed blasphemy there.
I don't think she'd mind if she heard it.

Well, tell me how you arrived at your theory,
Girllock Holmes.
Ugh! For the last time, I'm not copying the books!
Okay, I get it... Go ahead and explain.

I arrived at my theory...from what the letter said.
For royalty, the writing style would be rather
polite, right?
Well, yeah.

Additionally, that letter...it told me to not be
friendly with you, Cid.
In other words, the culprit knows you, Cid!

Well, since the culprit did name me, I guess that
follows.
But with her being a princess, it's a bit of a reach.
You and Alexia dated once, correct?

We pretended to date. The "pretended" part is kinda
really important.

Yes, yes, I know that. I heard as much from the lady
in question...
You mean, she told you?

Yes. She told me that you two weren't actually dating
and that you were pretending to date due to some
circumstances.
And she's still top of your list of suspects?

Perhaps she had a self-realization after you two
separated.
She realized...how you were in her heart, Cid!
Nope.
Then she was jealous of me for being by your side...
Jealous? Yeah, no. Definitely no.

B-But there was a scene in Girllock Holmes where
a jilted ex-lover turns to crime in a fit of jealousy...!
See, I knew those books were influencing you.

Well, I don't think there's anything wrong with
idolizing the hero of a story and aspiring to be
like her.

I know, right! "Girllock Holmes" is not only
entertaining, but it is filled with all sorts
of important life lessons for girls and...
Is this gonna turn into a lecture?

Oh! R-Right... I'd almost forgotten about the
threatening letter again.
So what's your next move?
Um...
You believe Alexia sent the letter, right?
I will...ask her directly.
Directly?

I've only spoken with her once, but I got the
impression that Alexia is an honest person.

She may have tainted her hands with the sin of
threatening someone, but I am certain she will
understand if I talk to her about it.
One can only hope.

I'm going to try to speak with her. So I'm going to
the girls' dormitory.
Okay. Well, I'll walk you there just in case.
Oh, you will? Thank you so much.
I'll wait outside until you're done talking.
Huh?

Why're you so surprised? I'm a boy—I'm kinda not
allowed in the girls' dorm.
Which means, I have to go...alone?

This time, Sherry is visiting Princess Alexia as a
detective pursuing a culprit, so she is filled with
even more nervousness than her last visit.

Hey, this is Girllock Holmes's moment to shine—I
don't want to step on your toes. I'll be watching in
support from outside the dorm as your assistant.

You're...going to be supporting me... W-Well, I'll do
my best!
*sigh*...

This isn't my first time here...but my nervousness
this time is beyond comparison.

But I can't back out now! I need Alexia to tell me
clearly how she feels.

If Alexia doesn't like my relationship with Cid, then
I'd rather she tell me so to my face rather than send
me that threatening letter.

But...what if she really does tell me so to my face?
Oh-oh-oh...how could I possibly face her after that?
Who's calling?

I-It's me! Sherry Barnett, a second year student from
the Academy of Science.
A few seconds pass after she answers through the door.
What is it this time? Well, no matter. Come in.
E-Excuse me.
Ugh...
After confronting Princess Alexia...
And the verdict is?

Alexia says she was...not at all involved in sending
the threatening letter.

And when I asked her if she had special feelings for
you, she vehemently denied it.

I have no romantic feelings for him whatsoever,
please stop the sick jokes, I would never stoop so
low as to threaten someone with a letter...et cetera.

Well, talk about your refreshingly blunt denials.
Then again, that definitely sounds like Alexia.

Ugh... Tell me, Cid...did you by any chance already
know what Alexia was going to say?
Mayyybe.
*sigh*...
My detective work was flawed...

I suppose I wouldn't be as skilled as Girllock Holmes
from the very start. And I was so looking forward to
saying it once I solved the case...
What is it?
Her catchphrase.
What's it like?
Case closed! You've been sleuthed!
...I see.

It's really cool, I swear! I have the whole series—
I'll let you borrow it sometime.
Th-Thanks.
So...what's our next move?
Uh...

All she's done is remove Alexia from the list of
suspects. She hasn't gotten any closer to solving
the case.

Now that my prime suspect is gone, we're back to
square one. I think I underestimated this...

I was mistaken to think that I could solve cases as
gracefully as Girllock Holmes can.
She solves cases within the confines of a story.

But finding the culprit from the long list of
students and instructors at both schools is
quite difficult, I'm learning.
Wanna give up?
Huh?
N-No! I won't give up!

Please, Cid, there is no such phrase as "give up" in
a girl-detective's dictionary!
Is that another line from the book?
Correct.

Even though things don't go as well in reality as
they do in the books, if nothing else, I wish to
share the same perseverance as Girllock Holmes.
I will withdraw for now and come up with my next move.
So we're picking this up tomorrow?

Will you go out with me to investigate again
tomorrow, Cid?
Sure.
Thank you so much! Well, see you tomorrow, then!

Sherry and Cid part ways for the day. Will they
make any progress tomorrow?

But...Cid will be going out with me to investigate
tomorrow, too, so I'm sure we'll make some
progress.
Go out with me...?

G...G-G-G-G-Go out with me?! Cid, I promise I didn't
mean it like that, okay?!

Oh-whoa-whoa-whoa... What if he misunderstood what I
meant? How could I possibly face him tomorrow?!
